Select all the applicable symptoms of chronic hypertension
Check for fundal height with tape measurement (In cm)
If you have any of these symptoms at any time, please go to the hospital immediately, because this can be dangerous for you and your baby's health
If yes, immediate referral to hospital
Refer to hospital within a week

Keep your baby's umbilicus clean and dry. Do not put anything such as oil on your baby's umbilicus. Look for discharge or redness in the umbilicus. These are usually signs of umbilical infections, if not treated on time could spread to your baby's whole body. Delay bathing baby for 24 hours after delivery. Wipe your child with clean wet cloth daily. You need to change your baby's diaper (home-made diapers of soft clothes) at regular intervals. You may have to change up to 8 to 10 times a day. The frequency may decrease after 6 weeks.

"Keep baby warm and carefully wrapped.
Two layers of clothes, with hat.
Wipe your baby's eye with a clean cloth, check for discharge.
If the baby's nostrils are blocked: wipe with a clean piece of cloth, pour one drop salt water into baby's nostril.
If the baby continues to have difficulty in breathing, seek medical help immediately."

"If mother or any family member has cough, fever, shortness of breath, or sore throat, mother (or family member) should wear a mask when holding the baby or breastfeeding. All family members should wash hands before handling the baby each time."
"* Vaginal Bleeding * Leaking fluid * Painful contractions * Severe abdominal pain * Convulsions * Fast or difficult breathing * Fear/Unable to get out of bed"

If a woman is 3 or 5 or 7 or 8 month of pregnant, please tell her to participate her in next month's group ANC in nearby.
**Also, If a woman hasn't participated in Group ANC up to 5 months of her pregnancy, suggest her to come to next group ANC in the nearby location.**
You have completed the ANC form. Please submit to complete.
This woman should be visited next for ANC on:
This woman should be visited next for PDF on:

"Condoms for all couples, can be used at any time, prevent sexually-transmitted infections as well as pregnancy. Depo can be used 6 weeks after the delivery, injection every 3 months, it is normal to have irregular periods with Depo. OCP can be used 6 months after delivery, pill taken every day, regular periods."

IUD can be used either immediately after the delivery or after 4 weeks of delivery, lasts for 12 years, it is normal to have heavier periods with the IUD. Implant can be used 6 weeks after delivery, lasts for 5 years, it is normal to have irregular periods with the Implant.

Vasectomy (Male sterilization) for couples who have no desire of more children, small surgery that can be done anytime. Minilap (Female sterilization) for all couples who have no desire of more children, small surgery that can be done on the day after delivery at the hospital, or 4 weeks later.

"Lactational amenorrhea: For women who will be exclusively breastfeeding their child (every 2-3 hours, with no other supplements like water or other milk), as long as there is no return of menstruation, this can delay pregnancy for 6 months after birth.
It is best to delay pregnancy for 2 years after birth. So after lactational amenorrhea it is important to transition to another modern method. There are many good methods available. Have you heard of any? Let us talk about the options."

"Why is Contraception after childbirth important?
Your body will not be ready or strong enough immediately.
You can take care of yourself and your baby more.
Delaying or preventing pregnancy will help your family from mental stress and financial burdens.
If you plan to have another pregnancy, delaying for 2 years will help ensure you and your baby will be healthy in the next pregnancy."

"The first milk is very healthy for your baby. Feed your baby as soon as possible.
Breast feed your baby frequently. For the first two months, you will have to feed your baby every two hourly (even at night).
Even if you don't produce enough milk in the beginning, you should not give up. Keep trying. The more you feed the more you will start producing.
For the first six months, your breast milk alone is enough for your baby. You don't even need to feed water."

"Painful contractions happening more than 4 times per hour, for more than two hours Breakage of water, discharge of mucus like or even blood stained show.
Sometimes there may be breakage of water even without increased pain, don't wait at home if you suspect water breakage.
For any of these signs of labour, proceed to your desired delivery location. Don't wait for more than 1 week after the due date.
If you are 1 week after the due date, go to the hospital to get help starting labour."

"Potential Danger signs that tell your newborn is sick
Unable to suck milk/stopped feeding well Difficulty breathing or rapid breathing (>60 times in a minute) Severe chest in-drawing Looking tired/ weak / inactive Redness around umbilical cord Red eye / eye infection Rigors / seizures / convulsions Looking bluish/ looking yellowish (yellow palms and soles) Crying for long time High fever Please take baby to health post/ hospital if you notice any of the signs."

"* Tiredness
* Vomiting
* Increased Vaginal discharge
* Cravings"

"**Harek baar khana chaar**
Pregnant Women should get 4 meals per day and each meal should contain 4 portions
* Portion 1: Carbohydrates( rice, potato, etc)
* Portion 2: pulses (daal, gedagudi)
* Portion 3: Green Vegetables, seasonal fruits
* Portion 4: Proteins (milk, eggs, and/or meat)"

"Stay at delivery facility for at least 24 hours after birth.
Get a check-up with baby on the 3rd and 7th days after birth, from the CHW or at the Health Post."
Do not carry heavy load during Pregnancy

"Things to remember during ANC visits:
* Pregnant Women should take 1 iron tablet daily.
* TT first dose to be taken as soon as possible, and second dose should be taken 4 weeks after first dose.
* Take Albendazole tablet for worms
* Get your lab tests done.
* Complete all 4 ANC visits"
This patient should be referred to the hospital immediately!
This patient should just deliver at the hosptial

Counseling: If less than 12 weeks, seek abortion care at health post/ hospital. Up to 9 weeks in health post and after 9 weeks to 12 weeks in hospital,
Counseling: Abortion is legal until 12 weeks so you need to make this decision before that time.
